newsitem.title: USA: Kohl's April same-store sales up 9.5 pct.
newsitem.headline: Kohl's April same-store sales up 9.5 pct.

text.p: Kohl's Corp said Thursday its same store sales for the four week period ended May 3, 1997 rose 9.5 percent from the comparable period last year.
Total sales in April rose 34.5 percent over a year ago to $223.7 million from $166.4 million.
Comparable store sales for the combined March and April period, which more accurately accounts for the shift in Easter, increased 10.7 percent, the retailer said.
For the year-to-date, same store sales rose 9.3 percent over the comparable period last year. Total sales were up 28.1 percent to $600.5 million from $468.6 million.

"We are extremely pleased with the continued strength of our comparable store sales, especially on top of strong numbers a year ago," said William Kellogg, chairman of Kohl's, in a statement. "Further, April sales were boosted by a stronger than planned performance of our first stores in the Philadelphia and Washington, D.C. markets," he said.
In April, Kohl's opened seven stores in the Philadelphia market, two in Wilmington, Del., one in Allentown, Pa. and one in Winchester, Va.
At May 3, 1997, the company operated 170 stores compared with 136 stores at the same time last year.
